Type.Name: Object

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi Object extends System.Object implements class GLib.IWrapper, class System.IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Base class for all of Gtk#.

Docs.remarks: Chain to this constructor causes a native type to be registered and a native object instance to be constructed.

Docs.param: The pointer to the native C object.
Docs.summary: Constructs the object from a C-based pointer to the GLib object.

remarks.para: This constructor is used to associate a C-based GLib object with its equivalent object in the managed world.
This method is called by the generated classes by the Gtk# framework.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddNotification (GLib.NotifyHandler handler);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddNotification(class GLib.NotifyHandler handler) cil managed

Docs.param: a to invoke when a GObject property changes
Docs.summary: Request property-change notifications for all GObject properties
Docs.remarks: This connects to the GObject "notify" signal with no detail argument, to receive notifications when any property changes.

Docs.param: the property to watch (the underlying GObject property name, not the managed wrapper property)
Docs.remarks: This connects to the GObject "notify" signal with a detail argument of , to receive notifications when that property changes.

Docs.param: the values for the properties identified by
Docs.summary: Creates the GObject underlying a managed subclass
Docs.remarks: This is the method used by managed subclasses (as opposed to classes that are just wrappers around C-based objects) to create their underlying GObject. It will be invoked for you automatically by when you chain to your subclass's base class constructor.

Docs.remarks: This method is used to notify consumers of the underlying GObject that something about the GObject property specified by has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual IntPtr Raw { get; set; }
.property instance native int Raw

Docs.summary: The raw GObject reference associated with this wrapper.
Docs.remarks: Only subclasses of Object can access this read/write property. For public read-only access, use the Handle property. This property should only be used from constructors to set a native object pointer instantiated by the constructor. The constructor should chain to base (IntPtr.Zero) on the base class to ensure that no other native objects are instantiated for the class.

Docs.remarks: This disconnects from generic property change notifications. (This only affects notifications created with the corresponding generic version of . It does not remove notifications for specific properties.)
